## ğŸ”¶ **Section 1: Set the Target Survey Page**

### ğŸ§© Nodes:

* `â° Run Weekly NPS Tracker` *(Schedule Trigger)*
* `âœï¸ Set Survey Page URL` *(Edit Fields)*

### ğŸ“ What This Does:

This section controls **when** and **where** to begin.

* The **Schedule Trigger** node is set to run automatically â€” for example, **every Monday at 10 AM** â€” to check the latest customer satisfaction reviews from a specific website like Trustpilot.
* The **Edit Fields** node allows you to define or update the **target survey/review page URL** (e.g., Shopifyâ€™s Trustpilot page). You can also set any other optional config like number of reviews, date range, etc.

### ğŸ§  Why It Matters:

* Allows **automation** instead of manual monitoring.
* Keeps your system flexible â€” you can easily change the source URL without editing the rest of the workflow.

---

## ğŸ¤– **Section 2: Scrape Reviews Using AI Agent**

### ğŸ§© Nodes:

* `ğŸ§  Scrape Reviews with Agent (MCP)` *(AI Agent)*

  * ğŸ”Œ `ğŸ¯ Prompt & Guide Agent` *(OpenAI Chat Model)*
  * ğŸŒ `Execute Web Scrape (Bright Data)` *(MCP Client)*
  * ğŸ“¦ `Parse Agent Response` *(Structured Output Parser)*

### ğŸ“ What This Does:

This is where the **magic** happens â€” using AI + Bright Data to fetch live reviews.

* The **AI Agent** launches a **headless browser** via Bright Data's Mobile Carrier Proxy (MCP), mimicking a real user to visit the review site.
* Itâ€™s guided by an OpenAI model that understands natural prompts, like:
  *â€œExtract customer ratings, comments, and dates from Trustpilotâ€.*
* After scraping, the **Structured Output Parser** turns unstructured HTML into clean JSON data â€” a list of reviews like:

  ```json
  { "rating": 2, "comment": "..." }
  ```

### ğŸ§  Why It Matters:

* Many review sites use JavaScript â€” Bright Data MCP bypasses anti-bot detection.
* No need to write complex scraping code â€” just describe what you want in plain English.
* This is your **data foundation** â€” reliable, structured, fresh.

---

## ğŸ“ˆ **Section 3: Analyze & Log NPS Results**

### ğŸ§© Nodes:

* `ğŸ“Š Calculate NPS from Ratings` *(Code Function)*
* `ğŸ“„ Log NPS to Google Sheet` *(Google Sheets)*

### ğŸ“ What This Does:

This is your **data analysis and reporting** layer.

* The **Function node** receives the scraped review data, calculates **Net Promoter Score (NPS)** by:

  * Mapping 1â€“5 star reviews into a 0â€“10 scale.
  * Categorizing users as:

    * ğŸ˜ **Promoters** (9â€“10)
    * ğŸ˜ **Passives** (7â€“8)
    * ğŸ˜  **Detractors** (0â€“6)
  * Calculating:
    **NPS = (% Promoters âˆ’ % Detractors) Ã— 100**

* The **Google Sheets node** appends this NPS result to a spreadsheet with columns like:

  ```
  Date | Total Responses | Promoters | Passives | Detractors | NPS Score
  ```

# ğŸ“Š **Track Satisfaction Scores Workflow**

## ğŸ”¶ **Section 1: Set the Target Survey Page**

* `â° Run Weekly NPS Tracker` *(Schedule Trigger)*

### ğŸ“ What This Does:

This section controls **when** and **where** to begin.

* The **Schedule Trigger** node is set to run automatically â€” for example, **every Monday at 10 AM** â€” to check the latest customer satisfaction reviews from a specific website like Trustpilot.
* The **Edit Fields** node allows you to define or update the **target survey/review page URL** (e.g., Shopifyâ€™s Trustpilot page). You can also set any other optional config like number of reviews, date range, etc.

### ğŸ§  Why It Matters:

* Allows **automation** instead of manual monitoring.

## ğŸ¤– **Section 2: Scrape Reviews Using AI Agent**

### ğŸ§© Nodes:

* `ğŸ§  Scrape Reviews with Agent (MCP)` *(AI Agent)*

  * ğŸ”Œ `ğŸ¯ Prompt & Guide Agent` *(OpenAI Chat Model)*
  * ğŸŒ `Execute Web Scrape (Bright Data)` *(MCP Client)*
  * ğŸ“¦ `Parse Agent Response` *(Structured Output Parser)*

### ğŸ“ What This Does:

This is where the **magic** happens â€” using AI + Bright Data to fetch live reviews.

* The **AI Agent** launches a **headless browser** via Bright Data's Mobile Carrier Proxy (MCP), mimicking a real user to visit the review site.
* Itâ€™s guided by an OpenAI model that understands natural prompts, like:
  *â€œExtract customer ratings, comments, and dates from Trustpilotâ€.*
* After scraping, the **Structured Output Parser** turns unstructured HTML into clean JSON data â€” a list of reviews like:

  ```json
  { "rating": 2, "comment": "..." }
  ```

### ğŸ§  Why It Matters:

* Many review sites use JavaScript â€” Bright Data MCP bypasses anti-bot detection.

## ğŸ“ˆ **Section 3: Analyze & Log NPS Results**

### ğŸ§© Nodes:

* `ğŸ“Š Calculate NPS from Ratings` *(Code Function)*
* `ğŸ“„ Log NPS to Google Sheet` *(Google Sheets)*

### ğŸ“ What This Does:

This is your **data analysis and reporting** layer.

* The **Function node** receives the scraped review data, calculates **Net Promoter Score (NPS)** by:

  * Mapping 1â€“5 star reviews into a 0â€“10 scale.
  * Categorizing users as:

    * ğŸ˜ **Promoters** (9â€“10)
    * ğŸ˜ **Passives** (7â€“8)
    * ğŸ˜  **Detractors** (0â€“6)
  * Calculating:
    **NPS = (% Promoters âˆ’ % Detractors) Ã— 100**

* The **Google Sheets node** appends this NPS result to a spreadsheet with columns like:

  ```
  Date | Total Responses | Promoters | Passives | Detractors | NPS Score
  ```

### ğŸ§  Why It Matters:

* Helps your leadership team **track trends** over time.
* Spot dips in customer satisfaction before they turn into churn.
* All automated â€” no spreadsheets, no manual scraping, just insights.
